intro: Cucumis kalahariensis, commonly known as the Kalahari cucumber, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, melons, and squash. The plant produces small, green, elongated fruits that are typically 5–10 cm in length. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five petals. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
